author: Beth Kracklauer
title: The Secret Spas of Paris - WSJ
text:
WHO KNOWS how many bottles of wine were consumed? On a rainy Paris night, I hunkered down with a group of friends for a dinner party of roast chickens with potatoes drenched in the drippings; we ate like people younger than we are. Corks continued popping. Dancing ensued.

Wisely, the women in the group agreed to gather the next day at the Grand Mosque of Paris, a Latin Quarter fixture since the 1920s. We wanted to sweat out the residue of the previous night’s decisions, and we’d heard the Mosque had a spectacular hammam,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
